definition: rifle (loanword)/also written 來福槍|来福枪
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: Sharks cruised toward her lone figure, only to be driven away by rifle shots.
sentences.chinese: 鲨鱼游向她孤单的身躯，只能靠来复枪来击退。

sentences.english: Riflemen at the embankment also had cut holes through which they could aim and fire.
sentences.chinese: 堤岸上来复枪手开好了瞄准射击的射孔。

sentences.english: The ribbon of the rifle is fabricated with fiber.
sentences.chinese: 来复枪的带子是用纤维制作的。

sentences.english: This rifle can chamber short or long cartridges.
sentences.chinese: 这种来复枪的枪膛可以装短弹或长弹。

sentences.english: We honored the fallen police officer with a rifle salute.
sentences.chinese: 我们鸣来复枪向那名殒落的警官致意。

sentences.english: He heard small arms and some rifle fire.
sentences.chinese: 他听到一些小型武器和来复枪交火的声音。

sentences.english: Clearly a rifle is the weapon of cowards.
sentences.chinese: 明摆着，来复枪是怂人的武器。

sentences.english: The rifle is able to throw a bullet about 4 miles.
sentences.chinese: 这把来复枪可以把子弹射出大约4英里。
